intro: Rapuntium splendens, commonly known as the dazzling bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Rapuntium splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
